channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Belarus jail terms for opposition figures Kolesnikova and Znak
item.description: Maria Kolesnikova receives 11 years in jail and Maxim Znak 10 on charges of trying to seize power.

item.title: MH17 plane crash: Trial hears trauma of relatives demanding justice
item.description: The Malaysian Airlines flight was downed over Ukraine in 2014, killing all 298 people on board.

item.title: French film great Jean-Paul Belmondo dies at 88
item.description: Star of Breathless, Jean-Paul Belmondo was one of France's most popular actors.

item.title: Montenegro clashes as Serb Orthodox Church leader installed
item.description: The fierce protests reflect tensions in the country, which broke away from Serbia in 2006.

item.title: Jean-Pierre Adams: Former France international dies after 39 years in coma
item.description: Former France footballer Jean-Pierre Adams, who had been in a coma for 39 years, has died at the age of 73.

item.title: German election: Who could succeed Angela Merkel as chancellor?
item.description: A lacklustre lead candidate and a surprisingly strong Social Democrat have blown the race wide open.

item.title: Feria: Rural memoirs stir longing for Spain's past
item.description: Ana Iris Simón's autobiographical book triggers a frenzied debate about the loss of village life.

item.title: Hamid Nouri: How Sweden arrested a suspected Iranian war criminal
item.description: Prosecutors have put Hamid Nouri on trial over a 1988 massacre in Iran. This is how they did it.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: How Europe's relationship with Joe Biden turned sour
item.description: In many EU circles, the honeymoon period for Donald Trump's successor may be coming to an end.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: The Paralympic dream that started at the supermarket
item.description: Aruba had never had a Paralympic team until a student in her 20s decided to make it happen.

item.title: Inger Stoejberg: Danish ex-immigration minister faces impeachment trial
item.description: Inger Stoejberg is accused of unlawfully ordering the separation of young asylum-seeking couples.

item.title: Do Abba's new songs live up to their hits?
item.description: The band have released their first new music since 1982 - but is it a hit or a miss?

item.title: Abba on recording new album Voyage and virtual concerts in London
item.description: The Swedish group unveil their first new music in almost 40 years and shows in London from May 2022.

item.title: Irish society 'can begin to hope again', says Micheál Martin
item.description: The Taoiseach (Irish prime minister) announces plan to end most Covid-19 restrictions by 22 October.

item.title: Feminist Collages London: Tackling violence against women with slogan posters
item.description: A movement that started in Paris, has now spread into locations across the globe.

item.title: Greta Thunberg: 'I'll go to COP26 if it's safe and democratic'
item.description: Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg says she does not think November's COP26 summit in Glasgow will lead to "much results".

item.title: Milan fire: Flames engulf modern 20-storey block of flats
item.description: The tower is only 10 years old and questions are being asked about how the fire spread so dramatically.
